channel.title: math.SP updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SP updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Limiting absorption principle for long-range perturbation in a graphene setting
item.description: arXiv:2504.13512v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper, we examine the discrete Laplacian acting on a hexagonal lattice by introducing long-range modifications in both the metric and the potential. Our objective is to establish a Limiting Absorption Principle, excluding possible embedded eigenvalues. To this end, we employ the positive commutator technique as our method.
item.dc:creator: Nassim Athmouni (IMB), Marwa Ennaceur (IMB), Sylvain Golenia (IMB), Amel Jadlaoui

item.title: A microlocal Cauchy problem through a crossing point of Hamiltonian flows
item.description: arXiv:2504.13693v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper, we consider $2\times 2$ matrix-valued pseudodifferential equations in which the two characteristic sets intersect with finite contact order. We show that the asymptotic behavior of its solution changes dramatically before and after the crossing point, and provide a precise asymptotic formula. This is a generalization of the previous results for matrix-valued Schr\"odinger operators and Landau-Zener models. The proof relies on a normal form reduction and a detailed analysis of a simple first-order system.
item.dc:creator: Kenta Higuchi, Vincent Louatron, Kouichi Taira
